content.description: Classic, and somewhat overlooked, version of the V10 line. Very sustained climbing on pockets through an arete.Start matched on large undercling pockets on left. Go up with compression on a long series of pockets up arete to a surprisingly pumpy finish.

Roof moves into a sustained pocket compression line up an arete. Used to be grainy, but has cleaned up a lot.The start the first ascentionist used is inobvious. Grab a right-hand pocket pinch. The left is a very bad hold, way down and left. Pull up and do a front lever to get to next left hand. Many ppl skip this, and use the best left they can reach, making the problem easier.There is a V8 version of this climb which has an obvious start (and is better, IMO). About 3 moves in from original line, start at big undercling pockets.
content.location: On a block to right of A-Frame.

content.description: Climb the triangular A-shaped prow from sit. Obvious line, great rock quality. The compression moves are fun and moderate, but the crux is the topout. Three options exist:- Crimp your way up the slimpers on the right- Do a proper mantel on the horn- Cheat and traverse left (V5.. doesnt count as a send!)Originally called Man Versus Rock but that name doesn't appear to have stuck.
A small zone with a few V8-10 classics and a sprinkling of less-classic moderates.
